channel.title: Awkward shit
channel.description:
So... not so good day... @ lunch, my friend told another friend that I like this one girl, which didn't go to well. He takes my water bottle, gives it to her and said "Here is a gift from *****" (name censor) I then had to walk over and get it back, and it was kinda awkward was where only kinda friends so it was a tad weird. Anyway so then %%%% and ##### (more censors) decide to yell, at the top of there lungs for anyone who cares within a 7 table radius to hear "***** likes $$$$" or "***** has sexual feelings for $$$$". Which was really awkward and made the rest of the day awkward and now a bunch of people know....
Anyway, 2 things for this topic.
1. How do I talk to her again maybe mention that in a way to make in un-awkward (because I haven't talked to her since) I don't have any classes w\ her, but we're both on Cross Country
2.Any awkward shit that's happened to you recently or in the past.

item.title: Awkward shit
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Man up. Remember she’s human and feelings of others don’t mean jack shit. Act mighty so she doesn’t think you’re a pansy and your chances are gone. I learned this the hard way, as back a while ago I posted something similar to this. Honestly, situations like these are pretty immature and if you continue your life acting like this around your friends and girls, then things won’t go well. If your friends are that pathetic and have nothing better to do than go around chicks you like and try to embarrass you, then don’t tell anybody anything and make your own moves.

Oh, and don’t ever tell her you like her. In fact, deny that you do. Instead, talk to her, maybe complement her, and remember to keep in mind that she should be the one to earn you, not the other way around. Even then, don’t tell her you like her, but ask her out, or else it will be awkward and could get worse if the right things don’t get said.

Read full topic

item.title: Awkward shit
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

Oh puberty…

Anyway, if you have feelings for this girl why avoid having her know this? That’s like wanting to have sex but turning down the offer.

Advice: become close with her, hang out with her almost every day during lunch (yes, you have to ditch your bros) and then start hanging out outside of school (ditch the bros even more) and just keep progressing. Don’t talk about past girlfriends, compliment her, don’t talk about other dudes and how funny and awesome they are, text/call her (but don’t drown her in text messages and calls), and social networking such as facebook can also be a nice way to have contact with her and also use a condom

Read full topic

item.title: Awkward shit
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

First, you need to stand up for yourself. Those assholes who think that it would be funny to yell out bullshit need to get smacked around a bit.

Second, tell her that if you do like her, you like her, explain the whole situation to her and if she’s a good girl she will understand, if she doesn’t she’s just a bitch and you are better off without her.
